quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Saint Nicholas and Biology
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, pilgrimage, biology. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What three things does the religious concept of the Trimurti represent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Creator, Protector, and Destructor

questions.question: In biology, is the Great Apes family a species trinity comprising of chimpanzees, gorillas, and orangutans?
Saint Nicholas died on 6 December.
According to the King James Version of the Bible, what did God command people to do always, day and night?
St. Nicholas is revered by both Orthodox and Catholic Christians.
St. Nicholas is believed to have made a pilgrimage to the Holy Land.
Which epistle states that there is one mediator between God and men?
Is Nona the goddess of death in the Roman myth of the triple spinning fate goddesses?
St. Nicholas the Wonderworker is the patron saint of which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Saint Nicholas was released from prison in 313, after this emperor issued the Edict of Milan, extending official tolerance to Christianity.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Constantine the Great

questions.question: Biology divides cellular life forms into three basic life domains. What are they?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Archaea, Bacteria, and Eucaryota

questions.question: In the Bible, are there any verses that strictly mention “trinity” as a term?

Saint Nicholas is one of the sources of the holiday figure of Santa Claus.
Where was the historical Saint Nicholas born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Asia Minor

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Jesus and Saint Nicholas
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, leader, margery. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: He was a Supreme Pontiff of the Roman Catholic Church and Sovereign of Vatican City from 1978 until his death in 2005.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pope John Paul II

questions.question: This Spanish knight founded the Society of Jesus in 1534.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ignatius of Loyola

questions.question: The splendid Basilica di San Nicola (Basilica of Saint Nicholas) is in Rome.
Junichiro Koizumi is a politician who served as Prime Minister of Japan.
According to legend Saint Nicholas provided dowries to three young women who could not afford to marry.
He was a Christian saint from Egypt and a prominent leader among the Desert Fathers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anthony the Great

questions.question: His name means King of Kings and he ruled the Malian Empire for over twenty years.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mansa Musa

questions.question: The historical Saint Nocholas was a Greek Bishop of what ancient town?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Saint Brigitta was a Swedish nun and founder of the Bridgettine Order.
What statement is true about Saint Godric of Finchale?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both of these

questions.question: Nicknamed Black Angel, he was a prominent commander in the Chechen separatist movement against Russia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ruslan Gelayev

questions.question: He was an African-American Muslim minister and an advocate for the rights of African Americans.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Malcolm X

questions.question: Margery Kempe was an English religious mystic whose autobiography is one of the earliest in English literature.
He wrote the third Gospel and the Acts of the Apostles.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Luke the Evangelist

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Anthony Monastery

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John of Damascus

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Emanuel Swedenborg and Judaism
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, swedenborg, isidore. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The first five books of the Old Testament are referred to as what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Torah

questions.question: What happened in April 1745, when Emanuel Swedenborg was having dinner in a private room at a London tavern.

options.text: He saw a man sitting in the corner, who told him: Do not eat too much!

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johan Henrik Kellgren

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

options.text: The Church of Our Lady Mary of Zion

options.text: that the presence of the spiritual sense makes the Word Divine
that the Second Coming of Jesus Christ had occurred
that the Last Judgement had already occurred

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: all of these

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Church of the Nativity, Bethlehem

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Witch and Witches
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, mean, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What does the word Rabbi mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: My teacher

questions.question: The witch hunts started as a result of the superstitions of some Catholic Monks. This Dominican monk is considered to be the initiator of the witch hunts as he prepared a detailed manual of deviltry for the Church.  It did not take long before women in Southern France were sent to the stake, condemned for cohabitation with the devil.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Aquinas

questions.question: Burning women who were supposedly witches was a common practice on the European continent. In England, however, they punished witches in this way.

options.text: Stabbed them with a silver lance

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hanged them

questions.question: Most of the victims of the witch hunts were women. However, there were some men also burned, accused of being witches. This is why.

options.text: They were more intelligent than other people
They tried to protect women accused of witchcraft
They often went out for a walk during full moon

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They tried to protect women accused of witchcraft

questions.question: As the witch hunts expanded, any woman could be tried as a witch, but in the beginning these were the most common victims of the Holy Inquisition.

options.text: Women of middle age who gave birth to twins

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Old, lonely women

questions.question: Why is the city of Hebron so important to Judaism ?

options.text: It is where the first Capital of Israel stood
It is believed that Abraham, Sarah, Issac, Rebekkah, Leah and Jacob are buried there
It was a stop on the way out of Egypt
It is where Jeremiah was born

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is believed that Abraham, Sarah, Issac, Rebekkah, Leah and Jacob are buried there

questions.question: The famous Salem Witch trial started with an incident in January, 1692. A Caribbean-born slave was accused of initiating the witch phenomenon. Twenty more people were killed as no one of them confessed to being a witch. What was the reason that triggered the Salem witch craze?

options.text: Several babies in the town were born dead
There were innumerable storms over the town destroyed the crops
A severe drought made the local river dry up
Eight little girls from the town got ill with strange symptoms such as convulsions, incomprehensible speech, and trance-like states

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eight little girls from the town got ill with strange symptoms such as convulsions, incomprehensible speech, and trance-like states

questions.question: In the context of Judaism, who was Abrahams wife ?
How many laws are in the first five books of the Old Testament?
According to Judaism, what work is permissible on Sunday?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Any work

questions.question: In Judaism, what do we call food that is permissible to be eaten?
The first woman accused of witchcraft was burned around 1275. This was the reason for her condemnation.

options.text: Healing a child with magical water

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Having intercourse with the devil

questions.question: Why will Jews not eat pork?

options.text: Pigs cause disease if not properly cooked
Pigs do not chew their cud and they do not have cloven hoofs

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pigs do not chew their cud and they do not have cloven hoofs

questions.question: It was a common conception that the number of people involved in the witchcraft activities could be boundless. For example, in 1609 the witch hunting French official Pierre de Lancre stated that all 30,000 dwellers of the French region Labourd were witches, including  these people.
Many of witchcraft confessions were extorted by means of torture, called ordeal. This method of torture was not used during the process of the ordeal.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The sound of trickling water

options.text: Her sorcery incited the attack upon Pope John Paul II
Her spells were the reason for the ozone hole
Her magic killed the child of a neighbour
Her sorcery caused a tsunami in Mexico

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Her sorcery incited the attack upon Pope John Paul II
